notes.text: New Red Hat build of Cryostat 2.3.0 on RHEL 8 container images are now available
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
New Red Hat build of Cryostat 2.3.0 on RHEL 8 container images have been released, adding a variety of features and bug fixes.

Users of the Red Hat build of Cryostat 2.2.1 on RHEL 8 container images are advised to upgrade to these updated images, which contain backported patches to fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Users of these images are also encouraged to rebuild all container images that depend on these images.

You can find images updated by this advisory in Red Hat Container Catalog (see References).
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. A maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumption in the HPACK decoder, sufficient to cause a denial of service from a small number of requests.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Within OpenShift Container Platform, the maximum impact of this vulnerability is a denial of service against an individual container so the impact could not cascade across the entire infrastructure, this vulnerability is rated Moderate impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding

notes.text: A flaw was found in Golang Go, where it is vulnerable to a denial of service caused when processing large TLS handshake records. By sending specially-crafted TLS handshake records, a remote, authenticated attacker can cause a denial of service condition.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: crypto/tls: large handshake records may cause panics
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The opportunity for a denial of service is limited to the golang runtime. In the case of the OpenShift Container Platform, this would be restricted within each individual container. There are multiple layers of guide rails (Golangâs Garbage Collector; OpenShiftâs resource constraints imposed at the container and cluster levels) which would require a malicious user to continue submitting attacks for there to be any enduring impact. They would also need access to external server resources to be able to send a massive volume of requests to cause a significant impact on server operations.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: crypto/tls: large handshake records may cause panics

notes.text: A flaw was found in Go, where it is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an excessive resource consumption flaw in the net/http and mime/multipart packages. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http, mime/multipart: denial of service from excessive resource consumption
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The opportunity for a Denial of Service is limited to the golang runtime. In the case of the OpenShift Container Platform, this would be restricted within each individual container. There are multiple layers of guide rails (Golangâs Garbage Collector; OpenShiftâs resource constraints imposed at the container and cluster levels) which would require a malicious user to continue submitting attacks for there to be any enduring impact. They would also need access to external server resources to be able to send a massive volume of requests to cause a significant impact on server operations.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http, mime/multipart: denial of service from excessive resource consumption

notes.text: A flaw was found in Golang Go, where it is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by memory exhaustion in the common function in HTTP and MIME header parsing. By sending a specially crafted request, a remote attacker can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http, net/textproto: denial of service from excessive memory allocation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http, net/textproto: denial of service from excessive memory allocation

notes.text: A flaw was found in Golang Go, where it is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an issue during multipart form parsing. By sending a specially crafted input, a remote attacker can consume large amounts of CPU and memory, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http, net/textproto, mime/multipart: denial of service from excessive resource consumption
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
For Red Hat Enterprise Linux,

* Conmon uses Go in unit testing, but not functionally in the package. Go is used only in test files, hence, not in the actual code, thus, conmon is not-affected.
* The CVE refers to multipart form parsing routine mime/multipart.Reader.ReadForm, which is not used in Grafana, hence it is not-affected.
* Butane does not parse multipart forms, hence, it is also not-affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http, net/textproto, mime/multipart: denial of service from excessive resource consumption

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Golang Go, where it is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an infinite loop due to integer overflow when calling any of the Parse functions. By sending a specially crafted input, a remote attacker can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: go/parser: Infinite loop in parsing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
